body.p: To his excellency Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned petition your excellency for the Pardon of Levi Lyons -- they state that said Lyons was at the october ^Aprile^ Term 1860 of the Carter Circuit Court convicted of the offence of forgery -- to wit of forging a not for some ten or twelve dollars on one Jonas Jordan who unites in this petition -- the petitioner Jordan was the prosecutor for the said offense he was convicted for the term of three years in pursuant to the judgment of said court he was placed in Penetintiary at Frankfort and broke Prison -- now we the neighbors of his family states that said Family is in great distress a large helpless family very poor -- and that said Levi Lyons who has been in the state of Virginia -- is greatly afflicted with dropsey and unable to do much labour and the great solicitude of the family induces us to pray for his pardon, that he be permitted to return home -- we are willing for his return -- his labour to the state worthless -- we asks this on the further ground that we are satisfied of this repentance, and of his good behavior in the future.
